method.name: POST
method.doc: The affClawbacks method is used when you need to retrieve all clawed back commissions for a particular affiliate. Claw backs typically occur when an order has been refunded to the customer

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: affiliateId
param.doc: The Id number for the affiliate record you would like the claw backs for

param.name: filterStartDate
param.doc: The starting date for the date range which you would like affiliate claw backs for

param.name: filterEndDate
param.doc: The ending date for the date range which you would like the affiliate claw backs for

method.name: POST
method.doc: This method is used to retrieve all commissions for a specific affiliate within a date range

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: affiliateId
param.doc: The Id number for the affiliate record you would like the claw backs for

param.name: filterStartDate
param.doc: The starting date for the date range which you would like affiliate commissions for

param.name: filterEndDate
param.doc: The ending date for the date range which you would like the affiliate commissions for

method.name: POST
method.doc: This method is used to retrieve all payments for a specific affiliate within a date range

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: affiliateId
param.doc: The Id number for the affiliate record you would like the claw backs for

param.name: filterStartDate
param.doc: The starting date for the date range which you would like affiliate payments for

param.name: filterEndDate
param.doc: The ending date for the date range which you would like the affiliate payments for

method.name: POST
method.doc: The affRunningTotals method is used to retrieve the current balances for Amount Earned, Clawbacks, and Running Balance.

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: affiliateIds
param.doc: An integer array of the affiliate Id numbers that you would like the balances for

method.name: POST
method.doc: The affSummary method is used to retrieve a summary of statistics for a list of affiliates

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: affiliateId
param.doc: An array of Affiliate Id numbers you would like stats for

param.name: filterStartDate
param.doc: The starting date for the date range which you would like affiliate stats for

param.name: filterEndDate
param.doc: The ending date for the date range which you would like the affiliate stats for

method.name: POST
method.doc: Creates a new contact record from the data passed in the associative array

param.name: Key
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: data
param.doc: an associative array of the data for this new contact record. The array key is the field name to store the value within

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds a contact to a follow-up sequence (campaigns were the original name of follow-up sequences)

param.name: Key
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: the contact Id number you would like to start the follow-up sequence for

param.name: campaignId
param.doc: the Id number of the follow-up sequence you would like to start

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds a tag to a contact record

param.name: Key
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: the contact Id number you would like to start the follow-up sequence for

param.name: campaignId
param.doc: the Id number of the follow-up sequence you would like to start

method.name: POST
method.doc: Returns the Id number of the next follow-up sequence step for the given contact

param.name: Key
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: the Id number of the contact record you would like to get the next sequence step for

param.name: followUpSequenceId
param.doc: the follow-up sequence Id number you would like to get the next step for the given contact

method.name: POST
method.doc: Finds all contacts with the given email address. This searches the Email, Email 2, and Email 3 fields

param.name: Key
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: email
param.doc: The email address to search contacts by

param.name: selectedFields
param.doc: The contact fields you would like returned

method.name: POST
method.doc: Load data from a specific contact record

param.name: Key
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: The Id number of the contact you would like to load data from

param.name: selectedFields
param.doc: An array of strings where each string is the database field name of the field you would like sent back

method.name: POST
method.doc: Pauses a follow-up sequence for the given contact record

param.name: Key
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: The Id number of the contact record you are pausing the sequence on

param.name: sequenceId
param.doc: The follow-up sequence Id number

method.name: POST
method.doc: Removes a follow-up sequence from a contact record

param.name: Key
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: The Id number of the contact you want to remove the sequence from

param.name: followUpSequenceId
param.doc: The Id number of the sequence you would like to remove the contact from

method.name: POST
method.doc: Resumes a follow-up sequence that has been stopped/paused for a given contact

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: The Id number of the contact you would like to remove the tag from

param.name: seqId
param.doc: The follow-up sequence Id number

method.name: POST
method.doc: Immediately performs the given follow-up sequence stepId for the given contacts

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactIds
param.doc: An array of contact Id numbers you would like to reschedule the step for

param.name: sequenceStepId
param.doc: The Id number of the particular sequence step you would like to reschedule

method.name: POST
method.doc: Removes a tag from a contact (groups were the original name of tags)

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: The Id number of the contact you would like to remove the tag from

param.name: tagId
param.doc: The tag Id number. This is found on the Setup->Tags menu

method.name: POST
method.doc: Runs an action set on a given contact record

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: The Id number of the contact record you want to run the action set on

param.name: actionSetId
param.doc: The Id number of the action set you would like to run. This is found on the Setup->Action sets menu

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds or updates a contact record based on matching data

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: data
param.doc: An associative array of the data for this new contact record. The array key is the field name to store the value within

param.name: dupCheckType
param.doc: Determines how to consider a duplicate record. Options: 'Email', 'EmailAndName', 'EmailAndNameAndCompany'

method.name: POST
method.doc: Updates the data on a contact record

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: The Id number of the contact you wish to update

param.name: data
param.doc: An associate array of the data for this contact. The array key needs to be the field name in which you store the value

method.name: POST
method.doc: To manage affiliate information (i.e. Name, Phone, etc.) you will need to use the DataService.

param.name: key
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: table
param.doc: The Infusionsoft database table name

param.name: values
param.doc: An associative array of data you would like stored into this new row in the table

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds a record to the specified table in Infusionsoft.

param.name: key
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: table
param.doc: Infusionsoft database table name from which you want to load a record

param.name: recordId
param.doc: The unique Id number for the record you would like to load

param.name: wantedFields
param.doc: The fields you would like returned from this row in the database

method.name: POST
method.doc: Return: (int) the new records unique ID number

param.name: key
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: table
param.doc: The Infusionsoft database table name

param.name: Id
param.doc: The Id number of the record you would like updated on the given table

param.name: values
param.doc: An associative array of data you would like updated

method.name: POST
method.doc: Loads a struct with data from the given database record

param.name: key
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: table
param.doc: The table you would like to delete the record from

param.name: Id
param.doc: The id number of the record you want to delete

method.name: POST
method.doc: Return: (struct) the specified fields for the given contact record

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: table
param.doc: The Infusionsoft database table name

param.name: limit
param.doc: How many records you would like returned. The maximum possible is 1000

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results you would like returned. The first page is page 0 (loop through pages to get more than 1000 records)

param.name: fieldName
param.doc: The name of the field you would like to run the search on

param.name: fieldValue
param.doc: The value stored in the field you would like to search by

param.name: returnFields
param.doc: The fields you would like returned from the table you are searching on

method.name: POST
method.doc: Updates the specified record (indicated by ID) with the data provided

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: table
param.doc: The table to look in

param.name: limit
param.doc: The number of records to pull (max 1000)

param.name: page
param.doc: What page of data to pull (in case there are more than 1000 records). The paging starts with 0

param.name: queryData
param.doc: A struct containing query data. The key is the field to search on, and the value is the data to look for. % is the wild card operator and all searches are case insensitive. If you would like to query for an empty(null) field, use ~null~ in your query parameter, such as ‘FirstName' => ‘~null~'

param.name: selectedFields
param.doc: What fields to return from the query

method.name: POST
method.doc: Return: (int) the ID number of the updated record

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: customFieldType
param.doc: Where the custom field will be used inside Infusionsoft. Options include Contact, Company, Affiliate, Task/Appt/Note, Order, Subscription, or Opportunity

param.name: displayName
param.doc: The label/name of this new custom field

param.name: dataType
param.doc: What type of data this field will support. Text, Dropdown, TextArea, etc.

param.name: headerId
param.doc: Which custom field header you want this field to appear under. Customer headers are located on custom tabs

method.name: POST
method.doc: Deletes the specified record in the given table from the database

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: username
param.doc: The Infusionsoft username

param.name: passwordHash
param.doc: An MD5 hash of the Infusionsoft users' password

method.name: POST
method.doc: Return: (boolean) True/False

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: module
param.doc: The application module this setting is a part of

param.name: setting
param.doc: The database name of the setting you would like the values returned for

method.name: POST
method.doc: This will locate all records in a given table that match the criteria for a given field

param.name: vendorKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft Vendor key

param.name: username
param.doc: An Infusionsoft username

param.name: passwordHash
param.doc: An MD5 hash of the users' password. This is the password used to login to the Infusionsoft UI

method.name: POST
method.doc: Return: (array) array of structs, one per result found. The struct will contain all fields specified in the method call with their corresponding value

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: customFieldId
param.doc: The Id number of the custom field you would like to update

param.name: values
param.doc: The preset values for the given custom field

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds a Free trial

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of the free trial

param.name: description

param.name: freeTrialDays
param.doc: The number of days free trial last

param.name: hidePrice
param.doc: The option to show or hide price

param.name: subscriptionPlanId
param.doc: The Id of the subscription

method.name: POST
method.doc: Returns the options and values of the free trial id passed

param.name: trialId
param.doc: The Id for free trial

method.name: POST

param.name: name

param.name: description
param.doc: Description for commission

param.name: applyDiscountToCommission
param.doc: Do you want to apply the discount to the commission?

param.name: percentOrAmt
param.doc: Percentage

param.name: amt
param.doc: The amount

param.name: payType
param.doc: This will either be gross or net

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds a order total discount

param.name: id
param.doc: The Id of the order

param.doc: Boolean integer to determine whether or not a discount is applied to commission

param.name: amt
param.doc: The amount of discount

method.doc: Returns the options and values of the category assignment for category discount passed

param.name: applyDiscountToCommission
param.doc: The Id of category discount

param.name: productId

param.name: percentOrAmt
param.doc: The Id of category discount

param.name: amt
param.doc: The Id of category discount

method.name: POST
method.doc: Returns the options and values of the product total discount id passed

param.doc: Id of product discount

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds a shipping total discount

param.name: name
param.doc: Name of shipping discount

param.name: description
param.doc: Description of shipping discount

param.name: applyDiscountToCommission
param.doc: Determines whether or not to apply discount to commission

param.name: percentOrAmt
param.doc: Percent or amount of discount

param.name: amt
param.doc: Amount of discount

method.name: POST
method.doc: Returns the options and values of the shipping total discount id passed

param.name: id
param.doc: Id of shipping discount

method.name: POST
method.doc: Create a new email template that can be used for future emails

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: pieceTitle
param.doc: The name of the template. This will be displayed within the Infusionsoft template library

param.name: categories
param.doc: The category of templates you would like this template saved in fromAddress - The from email address this template sends as. Format: "FirstName LastName "

param.name: toAddress
param.doc: The email address this template sends to. Typically this will be "~Contact.Email~"

param.name: ccAddress
param.doc: Any email addresses you would like to CC when this template is sent

param.name: bccAddress
param.doc: Any email address you would like to BCC when this template is sent

param.name: subject
param.doc: The subject line for this email template

param.name: textBody
param.doc: The content you would like sent in the body of the plain text version of this email template

param.name: htmlBody
param.doc: The HTML that makes up the body of this template. If you only send plain text emails

param.name: contentType
param.doc: HTML, Text, or Multipart

param.name: mergeContext
param.doc: Contact, Opportunity, Invoice, or CreditCard

method.name: POST
method.doc: Return: (int) templateId of the created email template

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: The Id of the contact you would like to add this email history to

param.name: fromName
param.doc: The name portion of the from address. I.E. FirstName LastName, not the email@domain.com portion

param.name: fromAddress
param.doc: The email address the email was sent from

param.name: toAddress
param.doc: The email address the email was sent to

param.name: ccAddresses
param.doc: Any email address that was CC'd

param.name: bccAddresses
param.doc: Any email address that was BCC'd

param.name: contentType
param.doc: What type of email this was. Text, HTML, or Multipart (case sensitive)

param.name: subject
param.doc: The subject line

param.name: htmlBody
param.doc: The html from the body of the email

param.name: textBody
param.doc: The plain text body of the email

param.name: header
param.doc: The email header information

param.name: receivedDate
param.doc: The date this email was received. This determines where this displays in comparison to other emails

param.name: sentDate
param.doc: The date this email was sent

param.name: emailSentType
param.doc: A boolean int, 1 is used for marking the email as sent inside the contact history and 0 is used for marking the email as received

method.name: POST
method.doc: This will create an item in the email history for a contact. This does not actually send the email, it only places an item into the email history. Using the API to instruct Infusionsoft to send an email will handle this automatically.

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: mergeContext
param.doc: Contact, Opportunity, Invoice, or CreditCard

method.name: POST
method.doc: Return: (boolean) True/False

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: templateId
param.doc: The Id number for the template you wish to retrieve details about

method.name: POST
method.doc: This retrieves all possible merge fields for the context provided

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: email
param.doc: The email address you wish to retrieve the status of

method.name: POST
method.doc: Return: (array) the available merge fields for the given context

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: email
param.doc: The email address to opt-in

param.name: optInReason
param.doc: This is how you can note why/how this email was opted-in. *If a blank optInReason is passed the system will default a reason of "API Opt In"

method.name: POST
method.doc: This method is not currently built into the iSDK

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: email
param.doc: The email address to opt-out

param.name: optOutreason
param.doc: Reason the address is being opt-out

method.name: POST
method.doc: Retrieves the details for a particular email template

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactList
param.doc: An integer array of Contact Id numbers you would like to send this email to

param.name: fromAddress
param.doc: The email address this template will be sent from

param.name: toAddress
param.doc: The email address this template will send to. This is typically the merge field "~Contact.Email~"

param.name: ccAddresses
param.doc: The email address(es) this template will carbon copy. Multiples separated by comma

param.name: bccAddresses
param.doc: the email address(es) this template will blind carbon copy. Multiples separated by comma

param.name: contentType
param.doc: HTML, Text, or Multipart (this is case sensitive)

param.name: subject
param.doc: The subject line of this email

param.name: htmlBody
param.doc: The HTML content the body of this email is comprised of

param.name: textBody
param.doc: The content of the plain text body of this template

param.name: templateId
param.doc: The Id number of the template you would like to send

method.name: POST
method.doc: Returns: (array) all data for a particular email template Example: Struct( [pieceTitle] => Example [categories] => Email [fromAddress] => example@example.com [toAddress] => ~Contact.Email~ [ccAddress] => [bccAddress] => [subject] => Example Subject [textBody] => Some example body [htmlBody] => Some HTML here [contentType] => HTML [mergeContext] => Contact )

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactList
param.doc: An integer array of Contact Id numbers you would like to send this email to

param.name: templateId
param.doc: The Id of of template to send

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: templateId
param.doc: The Id number of the email template you would like to update

param.name: pieceTitle
param.doc: The title/name of this template. This is the internal name, not visible to customers

param.name: category
param.doc: The category you would like to save this template in

param.name: fromAddress
param.doc: The email address this template will be sent from. Format: "First Last"

param.name: toAddress
param.doc: The email address this template will send to. This is typically the merge field "~Contact.Email~"

param.name: ccAddress
param.doc: The email address(es) this template will carbon copy. Multiples separated by comma

param.name: bccAddresses
param.doc: The email address(es) this template will blind carbon copy. Multiples separated by comma

param.name: subject
param.doc: The subject line of this email

param.name: textBody
param.doc: The content of the plain text body of this template

param.name: htmlBody
param.doc: The HTML content the body of this email is comprised of

param.name: contentType
param.doc: HTML, text, or multipart (this is case sensitive)

param.name: mergeContext
param.doc: Contact, Opportunity, Invoice, or CreditCard (this is typically Contact)

method.name: POST
method.doc: This method retrieves the file data for the given ID number.

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: FileId
param.doc: The ID of the file you would like to return.

method.name: POST
method.doc: This method will return a string of the download URL for the given file.

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: FileId
param.doc: The ID of the file url to be returned.

method.name: POST
method.doc: This method uploads the file to Infusionsoft. The optional contactId parameter is used to place the file in a specific contact's filebox.

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: FileName
param.doc: The name of the file to be uploaded

param.name: Base64EncodedData
param.doc: A string that is 64 base encoded.

param.name: ContactId
param.doc: ID of the contact record to add the file to.

method.name: POST
method.doc: This method will return a string of the download URL for the given file.

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: FileId
param.doc: ID of the file to be replaced.

param.name: Base64EncodedData
param.doc: New string of data.

method.name: POST
method.doc: This method will return a string of the download URL for the given file.

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: FileId
param.doc: Id of the file to be renamed.

param.name: fileName
param.doc: New string of data.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Creates a one-time order with no added line items

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: The Id number of the contact record this order will be connected to

param.name: description
param.doc: The name this order will display. This is also the hyperlink to the order found on the contact's order tab

param.name: orderDate
param.doc: Date of order

param.name: leadAffiliateId
param.doc: The Id number of the affiliate you would like placed as the lead affiliate. 0 if no affiliate should be attached

param.name: saleAffiliateId
param.doc: The Id number of the affiliate you would like placed as the sale affiliate. 0 if no affiliate should be attached

method.name: POST
method.doc: (int) Invoice Id for this new order

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: invoiceId
param.doc: The Id number of the invoice this item is being added to

param.name: productId
param.doc: The Id number of the product you are adding. If you are adding something such as tax, shipping, or a discount, make this 0

param.name: type
param.doc: The line item type - defined in the table below

param.name: price
param.doc: The price of this line item.

param.name: quantity
param.doc: The quantity of item added

param.name: title
param.doc: The name you want this line item to appear as

param.name: description
param.doc: A full description for this line item

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds a line item to an order. This used to add a Product to an order as well as any other sort of charge/discount.

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: invoiceId
param.doc: The Invoice Id you would like to charge the balance due on

param.name: notes
param.doc: A note about the payment. Ex: "API Upsell Payment"

param.name: creditCardId
param.doc: The Id number of the credit card being charged

param.name: merchantAccountId
param.doc: The Id number of the merchant account the payment is to process through

param.name: bypassComissions
param.doc: A boolean telling the system if this payment should count towards affiliate commissions earned. This is almost always false.

method.name: POST
method.doc: (boolean) True/False

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: invoiceId
param.doc: The Invoice Id you would like to charge the balance due on

param.name: notes
param.doc: A note about the payment. Ex: "API Upsell Payment"

param.name: creditCardId
param.doc: The Id number of the credit card being charged

param.name: merchantAccountId
param.doc: The Id number of the merchant account the payment is to process through

param.name: bypassCommissions
param.doc: A boolean telling the system if this payment should count towards affiliate commissions earned. This is almost always false.

method.name: POST
method.doc: This will cause a credit card to be charged for the amount currently due on an invoice

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: recurringOrderId
param.doc: The Id number of the particular subscription being deleted

method.name: POST
method.doc: (struct) a struct containing payment details. The struct will contain the following keys: Successful – true or false on whether or not the card was charged. (If there was nothing to charge, this will be false) Code – The approval code: APPROVED, DECLINED, ERROR, SKIPPED (there was no balance to charge) RefNum – If charge was successful, this is the reference number passed back by the merchant account Message – Error message for the transaction, if any

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: The Id number of the contact this subscription will be connected with

param.name: allowDuplicate
param.doc: If duplicate subscriptions should be allowed

param.name: cProgramId
param.doc: The Id number of the subscription you are adding. This is from the cProgram table

param.name: qty
param.doc: Quantity of this service/product price - price charged per quantity

param.name: price
param.doc: Price to charge for the subscription

param.name: taxable
param.doc: If tax should be charged on this subscription

param.name: merchantAccountId
param.doc: The merchant account this subscription will bill through

param.name: creditCardId
param.doc: The Id of the credit card this subscription will charge to

param.name: affiliateId
param.doc: The Id number for the affiliate being placed as the sale affiliate. 0 if no affiliate

param.name: daysTillCharge
param.doc: The number of days until this subscription should be charged. Essentially free trial days

method.name: POST
method.doc: Deletes the specified subscription from the database, as well as all invoices tied to the subscription

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: recurringOrderId
param.doc: The Id number of the recurringOrder(subscription record) this override is being applied to

param.name: affiliateId
param.doc: The Id of the affiliate earning this commission

param.name: amount
param.doc: The commission amount being earned

param.name: payoutType
param.doc: How the commissions will be earned. 4 - up front earning, 5 - upon customer payment. Typically this is 5

param.name: description
param.doc: A short note about this commission override.

method.name: POST
method.doc: (boolean) True/False

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: recurringOrderId
param.doc: The Id number for the particular subscription you want invoiced

method.name: POST
method.doc: Creates a subscription for a contact. Subscriptions are billing automatically by Infusionsoft within the next six hours. If you want to bill immediately you will need to utilize the InvoiceService.createInvoiceForRecurring and InvoiceService.chargeInvoice methods to accomplish this.

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: invoiceId
param.doc: The Id of invoice being paid

param.name: amt
param.doc: The amount of this payment

param.name: paymentDate
param.doc: Date of payment

param.name: paymentType
param.doc: Cash, Check, Credit Card, Money Order, PayPal, etc.

param.name: paymentDescription
param.doc: An area useful for noting payment details such as a check number

param.name: bypassCommissions
param.doc: A boolean which tells the system if this payment should count towards what the affiliate has earned. This is almost always false.

method.name: POST
method.doc: (int) Id of the newly created Subscription

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: invoiceId
param.doc: The Id of the invoice this payment plan is fo

param.name: autoCharge
param.doc: If the auto-charge for this pay plan should be enabled or disabled

param.name: creditCardId
param.doc: Credit card being charged for this pay plan

param.name: merchantAccountId
param.doc: Merchant account this pay plan will charge through

param.name: daysBetweenRetry
param.doc: The number of days Infusionsoft should wait before re-attempting to charge a failed payment

param.name: maxRetry
param.doc: The maximum number of times Infusionsoft should retry a failed payment

param.name: initialPmtAmt
param.doc: The amount of the very first charge on this payment plan

param.name: initialPmtDate
param.doc: The date the first payment should occur

param.name: planStartDate
param.doc: The date the second payment should occur for the payment plan

param.name: numPmts
param.doc: The number of payments in this payment plan. This does not include the original/first payment

param.name: daysBetweenPmts
param.doc: The number of days between payments in this payment plan. This first time this comes into play will be between the second and third payments

method.name: POST
method.doc: Modifies the commissions being earned on a particular subscription. This does not affect previously generated invoices for this subscription.

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: invoiceId
param.doc: The invoice Id number you would like amount owed for

method.name: POST
method.doc: (boolean) True/False

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

method.name: POST
method.doc: This will create an invoice for all charges due on a Subscription. If the subscription has three billing cycles that are due, it will create one invoice with all three items attached.

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: invoiceId
param.doc: The Id of the invoice you would like payments for.

method.name: POST
method.doc: (int) the Id of the invoice that was created, or zero if the subscription failed to generate any invoices (none due)

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: contactId
param.doc: The contact Id number for which you would like to find the credit card for

param.name: last4
param.doc: The last 4 digits of the card you need the Id number for

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds a payment to an invoice without actually processing a charge through a merchant. This is useful if you accept cash/check, or handle payments outside of Infusionsoft.

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: invoiceId
param.doc: The id of the invoice you want to calculate tax on

method.name: POST
method.doc: (boolean) True/False

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: creditCardId
param.doc: The Infusionsoft ID number of an existing credit card

method.name: POST
method.doc: Allows you to setup a custom payment plan for an invoice.

param.name: privateKey

param.name: CardType
param.doc: Credit card type (Visa, American Express, etc)

param.name: ContactId
param.doc: The Id of a contact to own the credit card

param.name: CardNumber
param.doc: Credit card number

param.name: ExpirationMonth
param.doc: Two digit expiration month

param.name: ExpirationYear
param.doc: Four digit expiration year

param.name: CVV2
param.doc: Card security code

method.name: POST
method.doc: Note** that in order to retrieve the Id number for saved searches you will need to utilize the DataService.query method and query the table called SavedFilter based on the UserId you are looking for the saved search Id for. Also note that UserId field on the SavedFilter table can contain multiple userId's separated by a comma, so if you are querying for a report created by userId 6, I recommend appending the wildcard to the end of the userId. Something like $query = array( 'UserId' => '6%' );

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: savedSearchId
param.doc: The Id of the saved search you would like columns for

param.name: userId
param.doc: The Id number of the user who created the saved search

method.name: POST
method.doc: Gets all possible fields/columns available for return on a saved search/report

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: savedSearchId
param.doc: The Id number of the saved search being run

param.name: userId
param.doc: The userId who the saved search is assigned to. If it is 'Everyone', you still need to pass a valid userId

param.name: pageNumber
param.doc: The page you would like results from. Zero is the first page

method.name: POST
method.doc: (struct) An array of fields available for returns when using the SearchService.getSavedSearchResults method

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: userId
param.doc: The userId you are checking access for

method.name: POST
method.doc: Runs a saved search/report and returns all possible fields

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key

param.name: quickSearchType
param.doc: The type of search you are running. Person, Order, Opportunity, Company, Task, Subscription, or Affiliate

param.name: userId
param.doc: The Id number of the user running this search. Results are dependent on this users' permissions

param.name: searchData
param.doc: String to run the search based on

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results you would like returned

param.name: returnLimit
param.doc: Number of results returned. Max is 1000

method.name: POST
method.doc: (struct) results of the given saved search

param.name: privateKey
param.doc: Your Infusionsoft API key
